intro: Hieracium leptocephalum, commonly known as the slender-headed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain regions.
